entries.content: Starting new ultra-modular refactoring session. Reviewing recent work: we've successfully refactored chat-tabs CSS (383→26-line orchestrator+13 modules), message-list CSS (776→32-line orchestrator+9 modules), tool-permission CSS (309→27-line orchestrator+5 modules), and triple message handlers (620+308+156 lines → 22 focused components). Looking at git status to identify next candidates for ultra-modular transformation.

Analyzing StreamInitializer.js (164 lines) for ultra-modular refactoring. Current structure has 6 mixed concerns: DOM transformations, placeholder-to-streaming conversion, provider-specific indicator logic, element creation, state management (streamedText, isFirstChunk), and provider name resolution. Good candidate for breaking into focused micro-components following our proven orchestrator pattern.

Created directory structure for StreamInitializer ultra-modular refactoring: components/, builders/, transformers/, coordinators/. Starting implementation with StreamStateManager to handle streamedText and isFirstChunk state management.

Completed all 11 micro-components for StreamInitializer refactoring. Now creating ultra-thin orchestrator that uses dependency injection to wire all components together. The orchestrator will be ~90 lines vs original 164 lines, with all logic delegated to focused components.

✅ StreamInitializer ultra-modular refactoring COMPLETED! 164-line monolithic file → 128-line orchestrator + 11 focused micro-components. Build succeeded with zero errors. All components follow single responsibility principle with clean dependency injection. Architecture: components (state, providers, utilities), builders (DOM creation), transformers (placeholder conversion, indicator handlers), coordinators (DOM refs, start flow).
